title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020 )), hereby
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Planning and Development (Increase in
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Planning and Development (Increase in 
maximum number of Ordinary Board Members of An Bord Pleanála) Order
text_norm: 1 order may cited planning development (increase maximum number ordinary board member bord pleanala) order

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020 )), hereby
Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020 )), hereby
heading: In accordance with section 104(2) of the Planning and Development Act
text_raw:
2. 

In accordance with section 104(2) of the Planning and Development Act 
2000, as amended, the maximum number of ordinary board members that the 
Minister may appoint to An Bord Pleanála shall be 17. This order shall remain 
in effect until 1 January 2025. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 August, 2024. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 23rd August, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [414] 3

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020 )), hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

In exercise of the powers conferred on the Minister for Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage by section 104 of the Planning and Development Act 
2000 (No. 30 of 2000), as amended, (as adapted by the Housing, Planning and 
Local Government (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) 
Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020 )), this Order increases the maximum number 
of ordinary board members of An Bord Pleanála that the Minister may appoint 
to 17. This is in addition to the Chairperson. This order will remain in effect until 
1 January 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [414]
